name: B. Spoilt Permutation
statement:
Vasya collects coins: he has exactly one coin for every year from to .
Naturally, Vasya keeps all the coins in his collection in the order in
which they were released. Once Vasya’s younger brother made a change he
took all the coins whose release year dated from to inclusively and put
them in the reverse order. That is, he took a certain segment and
reversed it. At that the segment’s endpoints did not coincide. For
example, if , then initially Vasya’s coins were kept in the order . If
Vasya’s younger brother chose the segment , then after the reversal the
coin order will change to . Vasya suspects that someone else could have
spoilt the permutation after his brother. Help him to find that out.
Check if the given permutation can be obtained from the permutation
using exactly one segment reversal. If it is possible, find the segment
itself.
